Alcohol-related liver disease is likely to become an increasingly big problem, given that alcohol consumption in India is increasing. Measures to reduce alcohol-induced injuries are in place but are not strictly implemented. It might be possible to prevent NAFLD through various interventions at all societal levels, such as the 14Â·5% fat tax that the state of Kerala has already imposed on the consumption of certain foods.
403 Far-reaching programmes to increase the awareness of the public and medical personnel on liver disease prevention are needed.
